    • Method Detail

      • getDbDriverClassName

        public String getDbDriverClassName()

      • setDbDriverClassName

        public void setDbDriverClassName(String dbDriverClassName)
        Parameters:
        dbDriverClassName: - class name of the database driver. Example: 'org.mariadb.jdbc.Driver'. The available drivers can be listed by using method getAvailableDBDrivers(). The DB drivers need to be included via separate jar files, such as 'mariadb-java-client-2.4.1.jar'. Either dbDriverClassName, dbUrl, dbUserName and dbPassword are needed or a dbConnection object

      • getDbUrl

        public String getDbUrl()

      • setDbUrl

        public void setDbUrl(String dbUrl)
        Either dbDriverClassName, dbUrl, dbUserName and dbPassword are needed or a dbConnection object
        Parameters:
        dbUrl - URL of the database. Example: "jdbc:mariadb://192.168.100.174/db"

      • getDbUserName

        public String getDbUserName()

      • setDbUserName

        public void setDbUserName(String dbUserName)
        Either dbDriverClassName, dbUrl, dbUserName and dbPassword are needed or a dbConnection object
        Parameters:
        dbUserName - name of the user to login into the database

      • getDbPassword

        public String getDbPassword()

      • setDbPassword

        public void setDbPassword(String dbPassword)
        Either dbDriverClassName, dbUrl, dbUserName and dbPassword are needed or a dbConnection object
        Parameters:
        dbPassword - password of the user to login into the database

      • getAppName

        public String getAppName()

      • setAppName

        public void setAppName(String appName)
        Parameters:
        appName - the table which contains the file system data is separated into different apps and those into tenants. Each app-tenant-combination has its own file system

      • getTenantName

        public String getTenantName()

      • setTenantName

        public void setTenantName(String tenantName)
        Parameters:
        tenantName - the table which contains the file system data is separated into different apps and those into tenants. Each app-tenant-combination has its own file system

      • isAutoCreateTable

        public boolean isAutoCreateTable()

      • setAutoCreateTable

        public void setAutoCreateTable(boolean autoCreateTable)
        Parameters:
        autoCreateTable - if true after connecting it is checked whether the file table already exists and if not it is created automatically

      • getFileTableName

        public String getFileTableName()

      • setFileTableName

        public void setFileTableName(String fileTableName)
        Parameters:
        fileTableName - name of the table which stores the file structure and data

      • getSchemaName

        public String getSchemaName()

      • setSchemaName

        public void setSchemaName(String schemaName)
        Parameters:
        schemaName - name of the schema where the table is located. E.g. "myschema" with table name "mytable" will cause statements like 'select * from myschema.mytable'
